variant.question: Which statement is correct with respect to the range of an NDB?

options.text: In order to double the range of an NDB, the transmission power should be increased with a factor 16.
With propagation over sea the range will be greater than the range with propagation over land.
The range depends on the altitude of the aircraft.
During the night the range of an NDB will decrease due to the interference of the direct- and earth reflected wave.

variant.question: Which of the following options states the correct frequency band, propagation path and frequency range for an NDB?

options.text: VHF only, ground waves, 108 MHz to 117.975 MHz.
LF and MF, surface waves, 190 KHz to 1750 KHz.
MF only, surface waves, 300 KHz to 1750 KHz.
UHF only, space waves, 329.15 MHz to 335 MHz

variant.question: Which of the following statements is true in respect to the range of an NDB?

options.text: At night the usable range of an NDB is reduced when interaction occurs between the ground wave and the sky wave.
At night the maximum range of an NDB is smaller due to the sky wave.
There is no difference in range of an NDB between day and night.
At night the usable range of an NDB is reduced because the propagation of the ground wave is better in day time then at night.
